Text: what softwares do you use for ripping blu-rays? i do have some blu-rays here and planning to rip it so i can carry it anywhere in my drive, hard to bring disc if your work is always on the move.
MeGUI with a bunch of custom presets and VirtualDubMod for muxing are my favorites.

i found a "district 9" torrent. r u able 2 use this as a source? http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5163765/District_9_2009_1080p_Blu-Ray_DTS_x264-WiKi%28No_Rars%29.  the source that vision used was 720p.BluRay.x264-METiS. did u find "the jacket" here?

The Jacket 'BluRay' (I'm assuming it's actually a 720p HDTV rip) I'm pulling from a web source.

Just finished downloading ESiR's District 9 BluRay, as it's a higher bitrate than WiKi's one. Now I need to learn how to hard-code subtitles, and make my own custom file.

On second thoughts I won't hard-code them, that will fuck up anyone who wants to watch with a different language sub.  I will make my own .srt for the non-English dialogue though as the ones I found aren't technically valid.

bummer about not hard-coding the prawn parts but i c where u r coming from. nero does not burn .srt. nevertherless, i m grateful that u r working on upping it. thx 4 ur efforts on "the jacket" as well. you rock!!! i want 2 nominate u 4 a skull but i dont know how. do u / does anyone know that can help me?

Ahhh true, and I guess the reason I make these rips is so they can be watched on standalone/xbox etc., which won't like separate subtitle files (that and my media PC is too slow to play 720p x264 lol). I'll hard code them and do another release without if anyone complains.
